In reality, cancer is a complex disease influenced by a wide range of factors, including genetics, environmental exposures, and overall diet quality. Focusing on a single food group like red meat oversimplifies the issue. A diet rich in a variety of whole foods, including fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins, remains the most effective approach to cancer prevention. Red meat can and should be part of a balanced diet when consumed in moderation.
